comments.body: This was submitted November of last year and it only has two votes and no comments? Really? This seems pretty simple...

This is really something that would benefit a lot o players, in old versions, when theres wasn't many blocks it didn't seem like too much trouble to sort your inventory by yourself, and this is in the way way older versions, I am a returning player, I haven't played Minecraft for years, and now to me this seems as a must have feature. There's just so many items I think it would be easier for a player to sort their chest if this was actually a feature in the game.
Love the game. So hard for me to look at a disorganized chest, though. Would also love a quick button to stack like items in your inventory to stackable items in the chest.

YES. This is a minimal feature and to be honest and I don't care that I'm mention Notches name, he, should have had this implemented, get it done MS.

It's really nice that these corps etc that make .. or no make and or take over .. another's game heh hem. .do so mostly with games that they buy, from others, they never do anything to the original mechanics like this, they leave it but change game play etc only to vamp it and make it new so more players join. Hey I get it, it works and it's good for the game.

It'd just be nice to have that chest feature. Been what now?; How many years?

 

IKR?; HillyBeast, should have been done ages ago, like I already .. hate to have to spray it again but hey, most games today.. have this as a basic feature. Like it's given. Usually. But hey it's MS so :) what can you expect, probably busy saving the world.

Just thought of something else.. what would it take for say idk some team to work on it?; Like what an entire day of code?; Maybe? I doubt at all very long.

One of my favorite features of Life In The Woods. Another idea would be to manually sort items once and then then lock the chest so that the order will always be remebered by the chest until it is unlocked again.
Desperately needed. There are and have been plenty of mods that did it, so it must be relatively simple.
My idea was similar to this but you can press a certain but for example food and farming items button you press it when in a chest and all food/farming items go into the chest

I was going to recommend this feature myself in feedback but it looks like you already did it for me.

 

+1 from me

Even the bare minimum here (no sorting controls besides the Sort button itself) would be a game changer.

The ability to click a button and have all the partial stacks combine and all the items in the inventory get collected, like-with-like, would be a huge time saver and a massive QoL improvement. Couldn't think of a simpler bang for you buck.

Getting fancy with different types of sorting would be great, too, but seriously you don't even need to get that advanced straight away.
I pray and hope this is added in Minecraft just like in Terraria and Stardew Valley.
Other games have storage sorting, this seems to be overlooked in Minecraft where storage is a really big part of the game.

Yessss! this would be sooo helpful. I have been saying this since day 1 of playing. if you have ever played grounded they have a sort button to organize everything makes it so much less over whelming when you have a ton of chests!

Hello^^

We are in 2024.
After spending countless hours on Minecraft, I believe that one of the most essential features to implement is a button in the chest interface that allows sorting items/blocks by similarity. When creating a storage room, it's a real pain to manually sort everything each time. While automatic sorting can be set up using redstone, not everyone knows how to use it... It's a shame to miss out on such a feature that would make the game much more enjoyable.
So, I vote for this idea and hope to see it implemented soon. Thank you!
There are mods in Java that do this... and I must say, it is incredibly nice to have, especially when you have chests full of mixed up items early in the game.

The option is there in docked mode but not handheld mode. The UI really is super tiny in handheld mode and I find it very hard to see what I'm doing without straining my eyes. There's plenty of screen real estate that the UI could expand into. Please give us the option to adjust GUI scale in handheld mode. You could almost double the size of the current UI and it would still fit on the switch screen.

SO MUCH YES!!!  We REALLY need GUI scaling in portable & docked modes on the Switch!  It has brought down the future likelihood of my wife & kids playing together with me considerably (she complained she couldn't see what she was doing, nor can I very well in either mode -- We've got a 48" TV!).  Can we get the pocket UI (edge-to-edge) on Switch (including & especially in split screen) for inventory/recipe/crafting interfaces?
It would be much needed to customize UI scale separately for handheld and docked mode respectively
I think that's a great idea, maybe with an option to hide the button if you don't want it.
Thanks JurscBeaver! :) I meant to mention that, I will edit that in

This would be a great idea for larger phones and tablets, not so much for smaller phones, I've tried playing on a smaller phone before it's already unpleasant enough. Give it a toggle option or have it off on default depending on the device.

And the annoying thing is... This exact thing exists on the Chinese version of Minecraft pe! Yes there is a button next to the pause and chat buttons that lets you change pov on the fly.

Hi Mojang, since you added an emote button at least have POV Button and also have an option to take it off like what JurscBeaver said and also maybe spread out the button so we don't have accidental touches.

I'm new here, but I love this idea, how can we know if mojang actually saw this is there a way of knowing if they will even consider this?
I really really desperately need a POV button near the chat or pause, this is a very good idea jurscbeaver! I can't believe mojang hasn't done this already.

dude... what you gotta do is download nvidia geforce experience.... and look for steps on yt.. Other programs like fraps and bandicam dont show fps in windows games or apps.
Bedrock
This will be helpful for Minecraft gameplay. Im excited if this feature got added into Minecraft Bedrock itself.

I have tried for a long while now, to make a resource pack which modifies the file "debug_screen.json", which is exactly what you were talking about. In the beta versions of the game, this file exists fully, (as in, it actually exists in the game) while outside of the beta, the file does nothing, except when you edit it to have custom text, not sure why it only works with that, but after a week of maybe 5 hours total working on the file trying to see where it works, I can conclude that it is probably only implemented in the beta versions. I fully support this motion, if Mojang went through with this, it would be a lot better if there was an option in the "Video" settings which says "Debug Bar" and it has a button to activate or deactivate it, from there, it can just exist. I am no programmer, but I would love to help with trying to get this done.

 

Edit:  AyhamGamingYT mentioned that you could just use NVDIA Gforce, or something close to that, some people don't always have computers to play on, and some also use the frames-per-second counters for testing the speed of servers. As crazy as it sounds, the game checking its own speed can be a bit more accurate when regarding how quickly it's receiving information from the server, I don't know how else to explain it, I just believe that an external fps counter will be a bit inaccurate, in certain circumstances, since the game fps counter will be slow when your game is also slow.
we really need this if fps meter is in beta versions why not in official version
Add debug bar to bedrock. Should not need resource pack for such a simple, useful option
the best gaming mine craft

I hope that developers can add color coding support for Ore UI and realize that Ore UI can be customized by code as the original json UI as soon as possible.

I aboslutly want this!!!!

There are so many achievements we cannot get on peaceful mode reguardless, but this is one that simply doesn't make any sense! No matter how peaceful the area, you still get hungry from running around and time going on, so why not add it? If you don't want to deal with hunger or mobs, go to creative mode, you can still gather resources and play normally.

PLEASE!!! I'm so afraid of monsters but minecraft with able be eat so much cozier!
Peaceful mode shouldn‚Äôt get rid of mobs it should just make them not hostile and maybe less mobs

This would be my single biggest request, too.  Peaceful mode is excellent for those of us who enjoy discovering, gathering, and managing resources without any violent elements in the game.  However, much of the experience feels a bit pointless if the hunger bar never depletes.  I agree, this would be great as an optional feature that can be toggled on and off.  I would use it right away.

We don't want monsters that spawn at night and explode, but we still want the survival experience of having a farm and hunting üë®‚Äçüåæ

Peaceful mode: Normal Minecraft without monsters(in the overworld only, if you go to the Nether you want trouble)
I agree!  I would love to be hungry in peaceful mode in both Java AND Pocket edition.  It would add more effort to survival worlds!

I really want more options in general - like choosing if you want hostile mobs to spawn, but not be hostile to the player by default (so that getting some resources doesn‚Äôt have to be so hard on peaceful) and getting hunger to deplete (with the option to enable or disable it) would absolutely be fantastic. It feels very punishing to not get basic game mechanics just because I‚Äôm afraid of monsters. (Also, just like the commentator before me, i strongly believe in the necessity to add that to both bedrock and java, unlike something like world customization that is only available for java)

I really like exploring and building in Minecraft, but my computer an me are to slow to react to the monsters. I'm often afraid of them, so I go to the Peaceful-Mode, but the aspect of hunger is away! Please add this option, this is my hope for years! :D

Just like there is peaceful, easy, hard for the general difficulty you should be able to change the hunger to match. but the rule is for achievements it must be at or above difficulty of mobs. if you have peaceful mobs you can have peaceful (no) hunger or anything higher depending on how much food you want consumed. if you have easy mobs you must have easy or harder hunger to get achievements, or can use peaceful hunger for no achievements. then its easy (i think?) to transfer the settings as the hunger just needs to be separated from the difficulty command, no new hunger styles created for peaceful mode as it can just be set to easy (or hard for those of us who make massive farms and really want to experience survival). I agree.The translation quality of Minecraft Bedrock Edition in other languages is too poor, especially some languages completely different from English, such as Chinese. If the translation quality is improved, the game experience will be greatly improved.

Apparently Mojang hires "professional" translation firms for Bedrock edition, but the results are often inaccurate, low quality or don‚Äôt make sense in the context of the game. 

Another annoying aspect are the differences between translations on Java and Bedrock, which causes confusion.

I don‚Äôt understand why they made this choice either because 95% of the strings can be shared between the editions. The Crowdin project would simply need to be split into Common strings (all the items, blocks, mobs etc.), Java-specific strings and Bedrock-specific strings.

I hope this can be done as soon as possible. In the meantime we can at least use unofficial packages (like the "Translations" addon which ports Java translations into Bedrock)

Ore UI is worse than JSON UI in every single way, it's laggy, buggy, blurry, it doesn't fit game style and looks more like unofficial clone of it, also it's oversimplified, and everything in it is way too big and looks like it was designed for mobile devices, there is also too much empty space in it, and empty space problem is even worse on lower UI scales, text is small, but buttons are extremely wide, and it can't be customized at all, while JSON UI can be fully customized with resource packs, also Ore UI uses CSS and HTML, so it's obviously for web, and using it in game like Minecraft is a bad idea, it will never be as good and fast as current JSON UI is, just keep JSON UI and keep improving it like all like you did all the years before, JSON UI looks amazing and fits game art style perfectly and is as fast as UI on Java Edition, and is nostalgic and overall is the best UI that Minecraft ever had, seeing Ore UI in Bedrock Edition makes me sad, please add ability to disable Ore UI completely and use original UI design (JSON UI) instead or remove Ore UI from the game entirely and use it only in spin-off games instead, thank you.

The old version of profile display was much better...

Hello, I am really a fan of this new player profile! I will definitely make use of the achievement tracker and stats checker. One suggestion I have is reintroducing the skin viewer and the total Gamerscore counter that were in the older JSON UI. Here is why I think these two features should make a return:

  • The skin viewer was an important resource for server moderators because it assisted them in finding players who used exploits to change their skin in an inappropriate way which could harm the fun and integrity of that server.
  • The Gamerscore counter was a good way to tell the amount of activity on the persons account and verify it the Microsoft account is not being used solely for malicious purposes. (such as hacking)

Below, I have attached a concept image that I made of what the profile screen could look like if the skin viewer and Gamerscore counter were added back. I tried to follow the design language of OreUI and kept things like the nice background banner that was present in the original OreUI player profile. Of course if players are uncomfortable with others freely seeing their skin or Gamerscore number, I believe there should always be accessibility options allowing that person to turn these off and return to the style of the original Updated Player Profile. Here is a glimpse of it I think the new OreUI player profile should look like:

To learn more about this I recommend taking a look at MCPE-184075 on the Mojang Bug Tracker.

Especially when playing Skywars or Murder Mystery also it is difficult to swap items at the same time or drop them. A shorter drop time should be added. Maybe you could add some buttons also enabled and disabled to switch items quickly between the slots it could be number buttons or < > buttons. It is 2019 and McPE needs better touch controls for Android and iOS!

Change the split controls's imput method by adding two buttons. One for: destroy block / Attack / eat food / drink milk, another one for: place block / use items / trade villager / use boat- leave boat / feed food.

Because it would be faster and easier than the current method. In the current method we can not move crosshair and do important actions (destroy block / attack / eat food / drink milk / place block / use items / trade villager / use boat- leave boat / feed food) together. By adding two buttons we can move crosshair and do those actions together.

Place the place block / use items button at mid right and destroy block / attack button at mid left on the screen. Make it vertically customisable for shoter screens and bigger screens.

If you guys do not want to replace the current method to this method than atleast add this method in optional on/off toggle, name the option advanced split controls.
Yeah we need real controls for touch screens and we need stick rather than having arrows an if you pull the stick way too forward then the players sprints

This would help a lot when using a crossbow. I can't use the crossbow because you have to long tap to shoot. By the time the arrow shoots, the crosshair moves. It's impossible to hit mobs with the crosshair.

Please implement this, it would be very helpful for us to play the game very easily.
Add another control method for touch controls in mcpe. Which should have two separate buttons for action. One for: destroy block / Attack / eat food / drink milk, another one for: place block / use items / trade villager / use boat- leave boat / feed food.

Because it would be faster and easier than the current method. In the current method we can not move crosshair and do important actions (destroy block / attack / eat food / drink milk / place block / use items / trade villager / use boat- leave boat / feed food) together. By adding two buttons we can move crosshair and do those actions together.

Place the place block / use items button at mid right and destroy block / attack button at mid left on the screen. Make it vertically customisable for shoter screens and bigger screens.

@Bilbo Baggins Not exactly. PUBG Mobile has somewhere around 20 buttons on the screen, and I personally never get confused about what is what. Though Minecraft is for younger ages, and just because I don't get confused doesn't mean others won't.

A variety of control options including the current (original), new presets, and fully movable and customizable buttons will encourage people who play mobile. To be able to personalize controls with great flexibility will also improve cross-play users to switch devices be it pc, console or mobile to play fully without being limited by the control options. Controllers, keyboards, and mouse (which do not function as how it's expected) may not be optional (or an option) to users will always refer to touch controls; and it being lacking to most, is very discouraging to mobile users.

Possible buttons:

Single tap button (attack, hold for mining)
Block place button (or item use)
Left hand right hand switch (shield & weapon slot)
Player perspective change
Item at hand drop
Item slot roller (previous or next equipment)
And so on . . .

Thank you for the great service!

P.s. Good reference for such flexible control options
[Mobile FPS Games] (PUBG, Rules of Survival, Call of Duty . . .)

This is a very, very good idea. Ore UI at the moment is pretty notorious for being hardcoded (unlike JSON UI) and thus, limits the amount of UI customization for resource pack makers, which is odd, considering that Bedrock has more resource pack customization than Java. (Especially for entity models) For example, what if i wanted to modify the achievements screen to have a different layout? Well, since the JSON UI file is overwritten by the ORE UI design, I can't really do anything about it. So a toggle between the Classic UI and ORE UI would be a very good idea. That, or if Mojang decides NOT to restore JSON UI, AT LEAST they should let us customize the ORE UI, not just via the layout, but also by the button textures, etc.
PLEASE ADD IT MOJANG

Once again, going back to my LCE UI point, none of the Ore UI screens are changed EVEN IF I HAVE IT AS THE ONLY PACK.
If they didn‚Äôt make it hardcoded, then the UI packs would work as they did pre-Ore UI.
Then someone online could make the old UI through a texture pack, and they could release it to the public.
You see where I‚Äôm going?
If not:
If they made Ore UI just the new UI and made it not hardcoded, then someone (or Mojang/Microsoft) could remake the old UI and release a pack to the world for free that gives us the old UI back. And if someone wanted to change the look entirely (like CrisXolt for the VDX packs (including the LCE one)), they could do it!
Although Microsoft probably wouldn‚Äôt like doing it, I‚Äôm sure it could get a nice amount of money. (If anything, it‚Äôs mostly Microsoft being greedy and making these changes, but Mojang also plays a small part.)
Like if a Bedrock player doesn‚Äôt recommend it to their friend/family because of the UI (hypothetical situation, the friend/family likes the LCE UI or old Bedrock UI more than the new Ore UI, but never bought it before, and now they don‚Äôt have a way to change it back), doing this change would make the entire scene for UI packs CHANGE.
(One more point: The only way to change it back was patched as of 1.21.100, so they‚Äôd NEED to make this change.)

Yes, I just want to clarify that this feature is highly required for any HOPPER BELT CONVEYOR!

‚Üí„ÄÄBeing able to filter out smelt-able items first in ANY type of farm is of very very high value.

Current problem: When you add smelter/furnace to your hopper chain, it immediately gets blocked because items that can't be smelted fall in.

 

(This really needs all the upvotes it can get)

Items that the furnace can't smelt should go into the top slot, then get rejected and go into a hopper below if there is one.
If there isn't one, the item will never enter the furnace.

395226333952 - Changing the hopper and furnace interaction to work the way you described is not feasible IMHO (from a programmers standpoint it's possible but with to many changes and downstream effects I think. The furnace shouldn't suddenly need information from blocks around it that can influence it's behavior. In this context only hoppers do that, but no block they interact with do that by themselves (chests, barrels, etc.)).

If, on the other hand, the furnace would get a second output slot where it'd immediately put non smelt-able items from the input slot, a hopper below the furnace could pull smelted items and the non smelt-ables from it.

But my preferred option is a whole other deal:

Change the furnace so that if it is powered directly (redstone repeater or direct line of redstone dust) the input hoppers get switched -> Fuel from above and smelt-able items from any side. Plus of course the input slot not accepting non smelt-able items and neighboring hoppers not being disabled by the powered furnace (this change might not be a good idea).

This way the furnace could actually be used as (possibly very slow) filter for non smelt-able items.


Or don't change the furnace at all and just allow item frames to turn hoppers into filters -> [<insert link to other feedback request here>]

I think this should be implemented as well. This already exists for brewing stands, where it only accepts water bottles or potions. This would greatly increase the efficiency of furnaces, make sorting items a ton easier, etc. PLEASE implement this!!

I can't put tools or armor in a bookshelf why can I put things that just block the furnace in the furnace.  If a smeltable item enters the top slot it should smelt, non smeltable or "cookable" shouldn't be allowed to enter.
Mojang, if you see this, please add this in an upcoming update. This will be great for item sorter contraptions

Yeah i use v, b and n as my hotkeys for the first 3 slots. And it is turning on the narrator

This would be especially useful if you have a bind on B, or especially if you have a keybind on CTRL+B, or are sneaking with sneak bound to CTRL when pressing a keybind on B. I, for instance may accidentally trigger the narrator when adjusting my Free Runners (modded equipment) mode (bound to B by default) while sneaking (with sneak bound to CTRL).

Fourthing this.  I recently started using Litematica, and with the drastically increased need for keybindings, it's really irritating having hidden, forced keybindings that can't be turned off or changed.

Agreed, why is this command hidden and impossible to modify?

I just tried to remap an overlapping command and ended up accidentally discovering this "feature".  I don't need Narrator nor will anyone who ever uses my computer.  Like the Windows accessibility shortcuts, it should be something I can disable forever at my choosing if the shortcut gets in my way.

I mean who hasn't inadvertently triggered StickyKeys on a Windows PC by holding shift in a game?  The shortcut being there by default is good for those who need it, but not being able to get rid of it is bad for those who don't.

I agree -- I use 'b' as my 'q' "drop item" key, and to drop an entire stack of items, I end up also toggling the narrator. 

Every other keybind is customizable, why not CTRL-B?  I'm fine with keeping the default as-is, but I'd like to change it to CTRL-N or something else for me personally.

 

(I don't like 'q' as my drop item key, because I accidentally drop stuff I care about too often, but I still want it close enough to use quickly when needed, so I suppose this is an "accessibility" issue for me, although my disability is being old and not good at video games.)
Disable this annoying shortcut plsssss

It's not even just a problem for people using special keybinds either. I use F3 + B (which can't be moved to anything else) constantly when collecting drops and I normally hold Ctrl for sprinting (the default keybind) to get around while doing so, which turns the narrator on constantly.

I wouldn't care as much if it wasn't so loud when activating, but it's louder than any of the actual in-game sounds are and has gotten me killed by making me unable to hear mobs approaching more times than I would care to admit.

I keep accidentally toggling this on because for some reason Minecraft likes to ignore the fact that I have sticky keys disabled entirely or something, and will assume I'm holding CTRL when I'm not, which makes typing in chat and using the letter B very, very annoying sometimes. Accessibility options are good when they're actually options and not forced or hardcoded to be immutable.

Now, the hotkey can be turned off in Accessibility Settings.
